item.title: LLM 0.22, the annotated release notes
item.description:
I released LLM 0.22 this evening. Here are the annotated release notes:
model.prompt(..., key=) for API keys chatgpt-4o-latest llm logs -s/--short llm models -q gemini -q exp llm embed-multi --prepend X Everything else
model.prompt(..., key=) for API keys
Plugins that provide models that use API keys can now subclass the new llm.KeyModel and llm.AsyncKeyModel

item.description:
python-build-standalone now has Python 3.14.0a5 Exciting news from Charlie Marsh:
We just shipped the latest Python 3.14 alpha (3.14.0a5) to uv and python-build-standalone. This is the first release that includes the tail-calling interpreter. Our initial benchmarks show a ~20-30% performance improvement across CPython.

item.description: This evening I spotted an obscure bug in Datasette, using Datasette Lite. item.title: Quoting Sam Altman
item.description:
The cost to use a given level of AI falls about 10x every 12 months, and lower prices lead to much more use. You can see this in the token cost from GPT-4 in early 2023 to GPT-4o in mid-2024, where the price per token dropped about 150x in that time period. Mooreâ€™s law changed the world at 2x every 18 months; this is unbelievably stronger. â€” Sam Altman, Three Observations
